Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= man, also known as Hoshea (הֹושֵׁעַ) and Jeshua (יֵשׁוּעַ) ◄ son of Nun (נוּן) tribe of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► one of the twelve men sent by Moses (מֹשֶׁה) to spy out the land; his name was Hoshea, later changed by Moses to Joshua (יְהֹושֻׁעַ) Moses' assistant, who later became his successor and brought Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) into Canaan (כְּנַעַן)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: by the hand (of someone); hence: = process by which a certain event is carried out by an intermediary (person) or instrument (object)
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= person who takes the life of another human
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: kinship redeemer|to fulfil one's duty as kinsman|avenger
Node.definition: = a person with the duty to help close relatives regain possession of objects that used to be theirs but that have become someone else's property, which may include their own personal freedom; this person also has the responsibility to avenge the death of a relative, which can also be seen as an act of redemption
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= to accept a person or animal into one's home or community

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home

Node.gloss: kinship redeemer|to fulfil one's duty as kinsman|avenger
Node.definition: = a person with the duty to help close relatives regain possession of objects that used to be theirs but that have become someone else's property, which may include their own personal freedom; this person also has the responsibility to avenge the death of a relative, which can also be seen as an act of redemption
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
= particle linking two elements and indicating that X is located or takes place behind Y
= causative action of controling and restricting movement; that is, to hand over a person or an object to another's control

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= person who takes the life of another human
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: (what used to be done) before, in the past
Node.definition: = reference to times in the past when a certain activity used to take place repeatedly
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= person ordained (מלא) and consecrated (קדשׁ) to perform religious services on behalf of others
= state in which a human being or deity has an elevated status, as a result of their authority, rank, wealth, or wisdom
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= person who takes the life of another human

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= causative action by which humans or deities set apart humans or objects for a particular purpose or activity relating to the service of God, as a result of which they become holy (קָדֹושׁ)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ territory of Naphtali (נַפְתָּלִי) ► assigned to clan of Gershon (גֵּרְשֹׁון) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as town of refuge; later captured by Tiglath Pileser (תִּגְלַת פִּלְאֶסֶר)
= region, also called Galilee of the Nations (גֹּויִם) ◄ located in the northmost part of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ sixth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and second son of Bilhah (בִּלְהָה) slave of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ territory of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) ► assigned to clan of Kohath (קֳהָת) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as a town of refuge
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town, later known as Hebron (חֶבְרֹון) ◄ located in the hill country (הַר) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) named after one of the Anakites (עֲנָק)
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= town, formerly known as Kiriath Arba (קִרְיַת אַרְבַּע) ◄ territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► assigned to clan of Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= an area dominated by elevations of the earth's surface

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= river; ◄ flowing from Mount Hermon (חֶרְמֹון) in a southerly direction through the Sea of Galilee (כִּנֶּרֶת) into the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח)
= town; ◄ located northwest of the Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► first town conquered by Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after they entered Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
literally: the rising (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ territory of Reuben (רְאוּבֵן) ► assigned to clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as town of refuge
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= an elevated flat area east of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) located between the river Arnon (אַרְנֹון) in the south and Wadi Heshbon (חֶשְׁבֹּון) in the north
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ first son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ in Gilead (גִּלְעָד) territory of Gad (גָּד) ► assigned to the clan of Merari (מְרָרִי) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי)
= area on east side of the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ◄ supposedly named after Gilead, son of Makir (מָכִיר) tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ seventh son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and first son of Zilpah (זִלְפָּה) slave of Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= town; ◄ in Bashan (בָּשָׁן) territory of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) east of river Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► assigned to clan of Gershon (גֵּרְשֹׁון) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) as town of refuge
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= group of clans (מִשְׁפָּחָה) united by a common leader
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= state in which an object has been selected for a particular purpose or role
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker classes within the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the widows, the fatherless, and other people who are poor

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= a human being, as defined by the life principle that animates him/her
= action by which humans act wrongly, though without the intention to do so
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: kinship redeemer|to fulfil one's duty as kinsman|avenger
Node.definition: = a person with the duty to help close relatives regain possession of objects that used to be theirs but that have become someone else's property, which may include their own personal freedom; this person also has the responsibility to avenge the death of a relative, which can also be seen as an act of redemption
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
particle linking two events; = relation indicating that event X ends at the time of occurrence or completion of event Y
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
